Articles.Content:
It took what I thought was going to be a failed launch to figure out that your velocity is really only the important thing. The atmosphere and weight of your vehicle just hinder your acceleration.

I was so worried about my AP and how high it was along with my speed when the thing I should have really been focusing on was getting close to orbital velocity as quickly and effeintly as I could before coasting in to circulurize.

I am making to orbit with a bit less delta v now.
Yep. That's how it works. This is an important insight in most player's learning process.

There's actually a really easy way to orbit if you can't be bothered with a technical launch. I've found that everything I want in space can be shot most of the way with SRB's. Strap on a bunch and get it up to 25-30k with them and you can carry absolutely ridiculous size ships out of the atmosphere. It IS harder to leave the atmosphere but it also seems a lot easier to abuse too.

That's a really great insight! Velocity is the thing. Drag and Mass make it harder to get more velocity.

In fact - "Delta-V" is mathematical notation (in Latin) for a "Change in Velocity."

SRB launchers are very effective and efficient now. I like it!

MOAR BOOSTERZ

SRB launchers are very effective and efficient now. I like it!

MOAR BOOSTERZ

Speaking of which...

SRM upper stages!

It took what I thought was going to be a failed launch to figure out that your velocity is really only the important thing. The atmosphere and weight of your vehicle just hinder your acceleration.

Velocity is second most important, Heading/Attitude is the most important part.

In fact - "Delta-V" is mathematical notation (in Latin) for a "Change in Velocity."

Well actually 'delta' is Greek and 'V' is Latin.

But that wasn't the point of your post so I agree.

How about stopping to chop each other into pieces and just enjoy the game?

Congratz, OP that you made it into orbit

Who gets taught what in which grade in which country is beside the point. Numerous posts trimmed from this thread. Can't we just be happy for a fellow player reaching an understanding milestone of the game?

What others may see as ignorance I see as an exciting opportunity for learning.

https://xkcd.com/1053/
Now you get to master the art of not wasting your precious dV on inefficient ascent profiles

Yep. That's how it works. This is an important insight in most player's learning process.

I think, really, that nothing else need be said.

There is always more reward for finding something out on your own than just cramming down what others tell you.
